result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Drozda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Taylor County Case Nos. 16CF112, 16CF38 and 16CF58

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full time employment at the agent's discretion.  Defendant shall undergo any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.     Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall have an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in court with attorney Shari L Post.  Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No factual inaccuracies in the PSI.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Agreement put into the record.  Argument by Attorney Post. Court orders 6  years prison - 3 years initial confinement followed by 3 years extended supervision with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; obtain/maintain full time employment at agent's discretion.  The bond shall be applied towards any restitution in all of his cases and the balance shall be put towards court costs.  Concurrent to 16CF112, 16CF38 and 16F58.  - rt

Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in court with attorney Shari L Post.  Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim Rights Complied.  Plea of no contest to Count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 2.   Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court Orders PSI.  Sentencing scheduled for April 18, 2017.  - rt

Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in court with attorney Shari L Post.  Defendant Daniel J. Drozda in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Defendant waives the reading of Information.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Pretrial conference scheduled for January 27, 2017 at 10:30 am. - rt
